utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: There's nothing to tell! He's just some guy I work with!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on, you're going out with the guy! There's gotta be something wrong with him!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right Joey, be nice. So does he have a hump? A hump and a hairpiece?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait, does he eat chalk?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Just, 'cause, I don't want her to go through what I went through with Carl- oh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, everybody relax. This is not even a date. It's just two people going out to dinner and- not having sex.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sounds like a date to me.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Alright, so I'm back in high school, I'm standing in the middle of the cafeteria, and I realize I am totally naked.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Had that dream.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Then I look down, and I realize there's a phone... there.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Instead of...?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's right.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Never had that dream.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All of a sudden, the phone starts to ring. Now I don't know what to do, everybody starts looking at me.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And they weren't looking at you before?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Finally, I figure I'd better answer it, and it turns out it's my mother, which is very-very weird, because- she never calls me!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: This guy says hello, I wanna kill myself.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are you okay, sweetie?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I just feel like someone reached down my throat, grabbed my small intestine, pulled it out of my mouth and tied it around my neck...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Cookie?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Carol moved her stuff out today.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ohh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Let me get you some coffee.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh! Oh!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, no don't! Stop cleansing my aura! No, just leave my aura alone, okay?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Fine! Be murky!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'll be fine, alright? Really, everyone. I hope she'll be very happy.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No you don't.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No I don't, to hell with her, she left me!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And you never knew she was a lesbian...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No!! Okay?! Why does everyone keep fixating on that? She didn't know, how should I know?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sometimes I wish I was a lesbian... Did I say that out loud?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I told mom and dad last night, they seemed to take it pretty well.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh really, so that hysterical phone call I got from a woman at sobbing 3:00 A.M., "I'll never have grandchildren, I'll never have grandchildren." was what? A wrong number?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Alright Ross, look. You're feeling a lot of pain right now. You're angry. You're hurting. Can I tell you what the answer is?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Strip joint! C'mon, you're single! Have some hormones!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don't want to be single, okay? I just... I just- I just wanna be married again!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And I just want a million dollars!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Rachel?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh God Monica hi! Thank God! I just went to your building and you weren't there and then this guy with a big hammer said you might be here and you are, you are!

utterance.speaker: Waitress
utterance.content: Can I get you some coffee?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: De-caff. Okay, everybody, this is Rachel, another Lincoln High survivor. This is everybody, this is Chandler, and Phoebe, and Joey, and- you remember my brother Ross?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi, sure!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So you wanna tell us now, or are we waiting for four wet bridesmaids?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh God... well, it started about a half hour before the wedding. I was in the room where we were keeping all the presents, and I was looking at this gravy boat. This really gorgeous Lamauge gravy boat. When all of a sudden- Sweet 'n' Lo?- I realized that I was more turned on by this gravy boat than by Barry! And then I got really freaked out, and that's when it hit me: how much Barry looks like Mr. Potato Head. Y'know, I mean, I always knew looked familiar, but... Anyway, I just had to get out of there, and I started wondering 'Why am I doing this, and who am I doing this for?'. So anyway I just didn't know where to go, and I know that you and I have kinda drifted apart, but you're the only person I knew who lived here in the city.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Who wasn't invited to the wedding.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, I was kinda hoping that wouldn't be an issue...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Now I'm guessing that he bought her the big pipe organ, and she's really not happy about it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Tuna or egg salad? Decide!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'll have whatever Christine is having.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Daddy, I just... I can't marry him! I'm sorry. I just don't love him. Well, it matters to me!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: If I let go of my hair, my head will fall off.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ooh, she should not be wearing those pants.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I say push her down the stairs.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: C'mon Daddy, listen to me! It's like, it's like, all of my life, everyone has always told me, 'You're a shoe! You're a shoe, you're a shoe, you're a shoe!'. And today I just stopped and I said, 'What if I don't wanna be a shoe? What if I wanna be a- a purse, y'know? Or a- or a hat! No, I'm not saying I want you to buy me a hat, I'm saying I am a ha- It's a metaphor, Daddy!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You can see where he'd have trouble.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Look Daddy, it's my life. Well maybe I'll just stay here with Monica.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, I guess we've established who's staying here with Monica...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, maybe that's my decision. Well, maybe I don't need your money. Wait!! Wait, I said maybe!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Just breathe, breathe.. that's it. Just try to think of nice calm things... Phoebe: Raindrops on roses and rabbits and kittens, bluebells and sleighbells and- something with mittens... La la la la...something and noodles with string. These are a few...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I'm all better now.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I helped!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, look, this is probably for the best, y'know? Independence. Taking control of your life. The whole, 'hat' thing.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And hey, you need anything, you can always come to Joey. Me and Chandler live across the hall. And he's away a lot.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, stop hitting on her! It's her wedding day!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What, like there's a rule or something?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Please don't do that again, it's a horrible sound.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: It's, uh, it's Paul.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh God, is it 6:30? Buzz him in!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Who's Paul?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Paul the Wine Guy, Paul?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Maybe.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wait. Your 'not a real date' tonight is with Paul the Wine Guy?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: He finally asked you out?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ooh, this is a Dear Diary moment.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Rach, wait, I can cancel...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Please, no, go, that'd be fine!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are, are you okay? I mean, do you want me to stay?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That'd be good...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, go on! It's Paul the Wine Guy!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What does that mean? Does he sell it, drink it, or just complain a lot?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi, come in! Paul, this is.. ... everybody, everybody, this is Paul.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey! Paul! Hi! The Wine Guy! Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I didn't catch your name. Paul, was it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, umm-umm, I'll just--I'll be right back, I just gotta go ah, go ah...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: A wandering?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Change! Okay, sit down. Two seconds.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, I just pulled out four eyelashes. That can't be good.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, Paul!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Here's a little tip, she really likes it when you rub her neck in the same spot over and over and over again until it starts to get a little red.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Shut up, Joey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So Rachel, what're you, uh... what're you up to tonight?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I was kinda supposed to be headed for Aruba on my honeymoon, so nothing!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Right, you're not even getting your honeymoon, God.. No, no, although, Aruba, this time of year... talk about your- -big lizards... Anyway, if you don't feel like being alone tonight, Joey and Chandler are coming over to help me put together my new furniture.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, and we're very excited about it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well actually thanks, but I think I'm just gonna hang out here tonight. It's been kinda a long day.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, sure.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Pheebs, you wanna help?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I wish I could, but I don't want to.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Love is sweet as summer showers, love is a wondrous work of art, but your love oh your love, your love...is like a giant pigeon...crapping on my heart. La-la-la-la-la- Thank you. La-la-la-la...ohhh!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm supposed to attach a brackety thing to the side things, using a bunch of these little worm guys. I have no brackety thing, I see no whim guys whatsoever and- I cannot feel my legs.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I'm thinking we've got a bookcase here.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It's a beautiful thing.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What's this?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I would have to say that is an 'L'-shaped bracket.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Which goes where?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Done with the bookcase!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All finished!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This was Carol's favorite beer. She always drank it out of the can, I should have known.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey-hey-hey-hey, if you're gonna start with that stuff we're outta here.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, please don't spoil all this fun.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ross, let me ask you a question. She got the furniture, the stereo, the good TV- what did you get?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You guys.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You got screwed.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: I know, I know, I'm such an idiot. I guess I should have caught on when she started going to the dentist four and five times a week. I mean, how clean can teeth get?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: My brother's going through that right now, he's such a mess. How did you get through it?

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Well, you might try accidentally breaking something valuable of hers, say her-

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: -leg?

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: That's one way! Me, I- I went for the watch.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You actually broke her watch? Wow! The worst thing I ever did was, I-I shredded by boyfriend's favorite bath towel.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Ooh, steer clear of you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Barry, I'm sorry... I am so sorry... I know you probably think that this is all about what I said the other day about you making love with your socks on, but it isn't... it isn't, it's about me, and I ju- Hi, machine cut me off again... anyway...look, look, I know that some girl is going to be incredibly lucky to become Mrs. Barry Finkel, but it isn't me, it's not me. And not that I have any idea who me is right now, but you just have to give me a chance too...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm divorced! I'm only 26 and I'm divorced!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Shut up!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You must stop!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That only took me an hour.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, Ross, you gotta understand, between us we haven't had a relationship that has lasted longer than a Mento. You, however have had the love of a woman for four years. Four years of closeness and sharing at the end of which she ripped your heart out, and that is why we don't do it! I don't think that was my point!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know what the scariest part is? What if there's only one woman for everybody, y'know? I mean what if you get one woman- and that's it? Unfortunately in my case, there was only one woman- for her...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What are you talking about? 'One woman'? That's like saying there's only one flavor of ice cream for you. Lemme tell you something, Ross. There's lots of flavors out there. There's Rocky Road, and Cookie Dough, and Bing! Cherry Vanilla. You could get 'em with Jimmies, or nuts, or whipped cream! This is the best thing that ever happened to you! You got married, you were, like, what, eight? Welcome back to the world! Grab a spoon!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I honestly don't know if I'm hungry or horny.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Ever since she walked out on me, I, uh...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?..... What, you wanna spell it out with noodles?

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: No, it's, it's more of a fifth date kinda revelation.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, so there is gonna be a fifth date?

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Isn't there?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah... yeah, I think there is. -What were you gonna say?

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Well, ever-ev-... ever since she left me, um, I haven't been able to, uh, perform. ...Sexually.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh God, oh God, I am sorry... I am so sorry...

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: It's okay...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know being spit on is probably not what you need right now. Um... how long?

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Two years.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow! I'm-I'm-I'm glad you smashed her watch!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: So you still think you, um... might want that fifth date?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: ...Yeah. Yeah, I do.

utterance.speaker: Priest on TV
utterance.content: We are gathered here today to join Joanne Louise Cunningham and Charles, Chachi-Chachi-Chachi, Arcola in the bound of holy matrimony.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh...see... but Joanne loved Chachi! That's the difference!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Grab a spoon. Do you know how long it's been since I've grabbed a spoon? Do the words 'Billy, don't be a hero' mean anything to you?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Great story! But, I uh, I gotta go, I got a date with Andrea--Angela--Andrea... Oh man,

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Angela's the screamer, Andrea has cats.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Right. Thanks. It's June. I'm outta here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y'know, here's the thing. Even if I could get it together enough to- to ask a woman out,... who am I gonna ask?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Isn't this amazing? I mean, I have never made coffee before in my entire life.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That is amazing.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y'know, I figure if I can make coffee, there isn't anything I can't do.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: If can invade Poland, there isn't anything I can't do.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Listen, while you're on a roll, if you feel like you gotta make like a Western omelet or something... Although actually I'm really not that hungry...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh good, Lenny and Squigy are here.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Morning. Good morning.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Morning.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Morning, Paul.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hello, Paul.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi, Paul, is it?

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Thank you! Thank you so much!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Stop!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: No, I'm telling you last night was like umm, all my birthdays, both graduations, plus the barn raising scene in Witness.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We'll talk later.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Yeah. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That wasn't a real date?! What the hell do you do on a real date?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Shut up, and put my table back.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Okayyy!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, kids, I gotta get to work. If I don't input those numbers,... it doesn't make much of a difference...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So, like, you guys all have jobs?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, we all have jobs. See, that's how we buy stuff.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, I'm an actor.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! Would I have seen you in anything?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I doubt it. Mostly regional work.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh wait, wait, unless you happened to catch the Reruns' production of Pinocchio, at the little theater in the park.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, it was a job all right?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: 'Look, Gippetto, I'm a real live boy.'

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I will not take this abuse.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You're right, I'm sorry. "Once I was a wooden boy, a little wooden boy..."

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You should both know, that he's a dead man. Oh, Chandler? Monica: So how you doing today? Did you sleep okay? Talk to Barry? I can't stop smiling.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I can see that. You look like you slept with a hanger in your mouth.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know, he's just so, so... Do you remember you and Tony DeMarco?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, it's like that. With feelings.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh wow. Are you in trouble.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Big time!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Want a wedding dress? Hardly used.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I think we are getting a little ahead of selves here. Okay. Okay. I am just going to get up, go to work and not think about him all day. Or else I'm just gonna get up and go to work.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, look, wish me luck!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What for?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I'm gonna go get one of those job things.

utterance.speaker: Frannie
utterance.content: Hey, Monica!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey Frannie, welcome back! How was Florida?

utterance.speaker: Frannie
utterance.content: You had sex, didn't you?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How do you do that?

utterance.speaker: Frannie
utterance.content: Oh, I hate you, I'm pushing my Aunt Roz through Parrot Jungle and you're having sex! So? Who?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You know Paul?

utterance.speaker: Frannie
utterance.content: Paul the Wine Guy? Oh yeah, I know Paul.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You mean you know Paul like I know Paul?

utterance.speaker: Frannie
utterance.content: Are you kidding? I take credit for Paul. Y'know before me, there was no snap in his turtle for two years.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Of course it was a line!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why?! Why? Why, why would anybody do something like that?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I assume we're looking for an answer more sophisticated than 'to get you into bed'.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I hate men! I hate men!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no, don't hate, you don't want to put that out into the universe.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Is it me? Is it like I have some sort of beacon that only dogs and men with severe emotional problems can hear?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, c'mere, gimme your feet.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I just thought he was nice, y'know?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I can't believe you didn't know it was a line!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Guess what?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You got a job?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Are you kidding? I'm trained for nothing! I was laughed out of twelve interviews today.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And yet you're surprisingly upbeat.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You would be too if you found John and David boots on sale, fifty percent off!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, how well you know me...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: They're my new 'I don't need a job, I don't need my parents, I've got great boots' boots!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How'd you pay for them?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh, credit card.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And who pays for that?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Um... my... father.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh God, come on you guys, is this really necessary? I mean, I can stop charging anytime I want.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: C'mon, you can't live off your parents your whole life.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know that. That's why I was getting married.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Give her a break, it's hard being on your own for the first time.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You're welcome. I remember when I first came to this city. I was fourteen. My mom had just killed herself and my step-dad was back in prison, and I got here, and I didn't know anybody. And I ended up living with this albino guy who was, like, cleaning windshields outside port authority, and then he killed himself, and then I found aromatherapy. So believe me, I know exactly how you feel.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The word you're looking for is 'Anyway'...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, you ready?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No. No, no, I'm not ready! How can I be ready? "Hey, Rach! You ready to jump out the airplane without your parachute?" Come on, I can't do this!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You can, I know you can!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don't think so.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on, you made coffee! You can do anything!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: C'mon, cut. Cut, cut, cut,...

utterance.speaker: All

utterance.speaker: Rachel

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay. You know you probably didn't know this, but back in high school, I had a, um, major crush on you.

utterance.content: I knew.

utterance.speaker: Ross

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I did.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh. Listen, do you think- and try not to let my intense vulnerability become any kind of a factor here- but do you think it would be okay if I asked you out? Sometime? Maybe?
